dfischer.utils

Class ApicaLoadTestPortalHttpCall

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.ApicaLoadTestPortalHttpCall

  • public class ApicaLoadTestPortalHttpCall
extends java.lang.Object
    Execute a HTTP/S call against the APICA LoadTest Portal.
    See Also:
    ApicaLoadTestPortalApiConfig

      Create a new instance.

      HttpTestURL execute(java.lang.String urlPathMethod)
      Execute a HTTP/S call against the APICA LoadTest Portal.

      Get additional debug information about the executed HTTP(S) call in case when the communication to the APICA LoadTest Portal did fail.

        Create a new instance.

    • Method Detail

      • setHttpRequestMethod

        public void setHttpRequestMethod(java.lang.String httpRequestMethod)
        Set the HTTP request method. Note: The default HTTP request method 'GET' is used if this (Java) method is never called.
        Parameters:
        httpRequestMethod - the HTTP request method used by the HTTP/S call.
        See Also:
        execute(String urlPathMethod)

      • setHttpRequestContent

        public void setHttpRequestContent(byte[] httpRequestContent,
                         java.lang.String httpRequestContentType)
        Set the HTTP request content. Note: no HTTP request content is transmitted if this (Java) method is never called.
        Parameters:
        httpRequestContent - the HTTP request content
        httpRequestContentType - the MIME type (data type) of the HTTP request content
        See Also:
        execute(String urlPathMethod)

      • setExpectedHttpResponseCode

        public void setExpectedHttpResponseCode(int httpResponseCode)
        Set the expected HTTP response code. If the received HTTP response code is not equal to the expected HTTP response code the (Java) method execute(String urlPathMethod) will throw an IOException.
         
        Note: If this (Java) method is never called the HTTP response code is not checked by execute(String urlPathMethod).
        Parameters:
        httpResponseCode - the expected HTTP response code
        See Also:
        execute(String urlPathMethod)

      • execute

        public HttpTestURL execute(java.lang.String urlPathMethod)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Execute a HTTP/S call against the APICA LoadTest Portal. If an expected HTTP response code is configured this method will throw an IOException when the received HTTP response code is not equal to the expected HTTP response code.
        Parameters:
        urlPathMethod - the URL path method (API method) inclusive (optional) CGI parameters. Note: the full URL path used by the HTTP/S call is ApicaLoadTestPortalApiConfig.getPortalApiPath() + urlPathMethod
        Returns:
        the data of the executed HTTP/S call
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        setExpectedHttpResponseCode(int httpResponseCode), ApicaLoadTestPortalApiConfig.getPortalApiPath()

      • getLogVector

        public LogVector getLogVector()
        Get the log vector of the HTTP/S call executed in the method execute(String urlPathMethod).
        Returns:
        the log vector of the HTTP/S call
        See Also:
        execute(String urlPathMethod)

      • getHttpResult

        public HttpTestURL getHttpResult()
        Get additional debug information about the executed HTTP(S) call in case when the communication to the APICA LoadTest Portal did fail.
        Returns:
        additional debug information
